intro: Memecylon strychnoides, commonly known as the Indian mallow or karanj, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
